contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, fine dust levels have returned to normal for a bit, but I hear it'll be going right back up again.
What's it looking like now?

Well, Conn-young. With the ultrafine dust and yellow dust coming in from overseas, air quality across the nation is not looking so great. Many of you might be wondering about the difference between the two. Well, as the name suggests, ultrafine dust are composed of smaller particles, so it can penetrate more deeply into our respiratory system.

And that being said, fine dust concentrations across the northern region are forecast to remain at "bad" levels until tomorrow, while southern regions such as Gwangju and Busan will temporarily rise to "very bad," so please be aware.

We had some pretty cool spells today but temperatures will rise back up tomorrow. On Thursday, the mercury will reach up to 25 degrees, which is the average for early summer. On Friday and Saturday, rain is in forecast nationwide.

We'll start off with sunny skies tomorrow, with Seoul and Gwangju at 10 degrees and Daegu 11.

Daytime highs in Seoul will reach 21 degrees, Gwangju 23 and Daegu 26.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo and Beijing will have sunny spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Cool spells across the nation with 'bad' levels of fine dust tomorrow
Updated: 2020-05-12 17:03:15 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. Wherever you are in the country, you won't be able to escape from the toxic dust. Smog from outside Korea will choke the entire nation, with the fine dust reaching very bad levels in the capital area and Chungcheongnam-do Province.

But you can dress lighter if you are in the east of the country, it will be as warm as yesterday, with highs in the mid to upper twenties, while those of us in the west will have a breezier day with highs hovering below the seasonal norms.

Seoul will hit 19 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju at 26 degrees. Sunny skies are in store, but the skyline will be hidden by the smog while winds will pick up in central regions and coastal areas from the afternoon.

We'll see big temperature swings this week, and there is nationwide rain in store for Friday and Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Fine dust to choke whole nation
Updated: 2020-05-12 07:19:50 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. It's a chillier start to the day, dress accordingly on your way out. Afternoon highs will also be breezier hovering below the seasonal norms all day. But it's a fresh start to the day for the capital.

But we won't be able to escape from the nasty air today. Toxic smog from outside Korea is affecting Jeolla-do and Jeju in the morning. Then yellow dust will blow in boosting dust levels in the capital and other regions in the afternoon

Moving on to our readings for the day, a cool and breezy start for most regions, Seoul at 10.6 degrees, Gwangju at 13 degrees Celsius.

Sunny skies are in store, but the skyline will be blurred due to the smog. It will be cooler for central regions, but southern provinces will be as warm as yesterday.

Big temperature differences continue for a while with nationwide rain in store on Friday and Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Cool start to day, nasty air to blow in again
Updated: 2020-05-12 06:23:01 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, as the hot weather began to ease, almost the whole nation has been subjected to some thick, fine dust today. Fine dust levels have surged to 'very bad' levels in Seoul and in other areas too. What can you tell us about that?

Right, Conn-young. Due to the steady influx of dust particles from overseas, fine dust concentration levels are sky-rocketing. Those levels are standing at 'very bad' in the Seoul metropolitan area and so an advisory has been issued in the capital and in Gangwon-do Province. Level 'bad' is being observed in parts of Chungcheong-do Province and other parts of Gangwon-do Province. So for those planning to head out, please make sure to wear a mask.

Rain is in forecast starting from late tonight in some central regions, as well as in parts of Jeollabuk-do and Gyeongsangbuk-do provinces. The amount of rain will be less than 5 millimeters.

Central parts of the nation will have cooler spells tomorrow, while southern regions will be mild. Seoul will be 12 degrees Celsius and Busan 16.

Daytime temperatures will be 1 to 4 degrees lower than today's. Seoul will reach up to 20 degrees, Busan 22.

We'll be able to escape any sweltering heat for this week as rain is in forecast across South Korea for Friday and Saturday.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Fine dust advisory in Seoul, light showers in forecast for late tonight

contents.context:

Temperature-wise, numbers will be 3 to 8 degrees higher today in most parts, hovering blow the seasonal norms for upper regions, but southern parts of the country will have early summer like readings.

For a closer look, Gyeongju will get up to 28 degrees, Daegu at 27 degrees. Seoul 21 degrees. We'll see more clouds than sun today.

Readings will remain below the norms for the first half of the week, and rain is in store for Friday which could linger until Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

Good morning. It's a dusty and foggy start to the new week for those of us in the capital regions, Chungcheongnam-do and Gangwon-do Province. Be aware of high levels of yellow dust, but conditions are forecast to get better by the afternoon.

It was a cloudy and breezy Sunday, but temperatures will rise but it will still hover lower than the norms in central regions while southern parts of the country will have warmer highs.

Morning temperatures are similar to yesterday, ranging from 11 to 16 degrees Celsius under bright skies.

Clouds will move in to inland regions with light rain in store from tonight while the rest will stay mostly sunny. Highs will be 3 to 8 degrees higher today.

Readings will stay below the norms for the first half of the week, and rain is in store for Friday which could linger until Saturday.

contents.headline:
Weather
Updated: 2020-05-10 10:21:48 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather. Let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, the heatwave we experienced today is gradually starting to subside now, as we have rainfall in forecast for the weekend. What's the condition looking like now?

Well, Conn-young. The sky is filling with clouds at a faster rate now as we're getting close to the end of the day. Rain is expected starting this evening and this will sweep away the summer heatwave we’ve been having. Showers will begin starting from the western regions and wil graually expand towards the east by late tonight. By early tomorrow morning, rain wll have spread nationwide.

Looking at the precipitation levels. In the West Coast and parts of inland regions approximately 30 to 80mm of rain are forecasted. And in Jeju and Southern areas, heavy rain of 50 to 100mm per hour and even strong thunders are to come along, so please be aware. Rain in most regions are expected to continue until Sunday.

It will be a cool morning tomorrow with Seoul at 15 degrees and Busan16.

Daytime temperatures will hover around 20 to 22 degrees and will be fairly mild.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will be partly sunny and Beijing will be mostly cloudy throughout the day.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Rain in forecast for tonight...heat to diminish
Updated: 2020-05-08 17:29:52 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. Some much needed rain is in store nationwide. We'll be seeing rain from this evening in the west before it spreads to the rest of the country by tonight. Jeju and southern coastal regions will see 50 to 100 millimeters, Seoul will see between 30 to 80 into Saturday.

Temperatures will return to seasonal norms tomorrow but due to the summer like readings we've had lately it could feel like a significant cool down with dark clouds. So if you have special plan for Parents' Day weekend take the weather into account

Blue skies will be abundant in eastern parts of the country during the day. It's going to be a warm afternoon. Seoul, Gyeongju and Chuncheon getting up to 26 degrees,

Sunshine and balmy temperatures are in store next week. Readings on the rise again

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Highly anticipated rain in store nationwide from this evening
